GT.content: reader is not deceived [like narrator], experiences a secret w/out depth, a secret w/out secret
GT.linkedContent: reader is not deceived [like narrator], experiences a secret w/out depth, a secret w/out secret

GT.content: not probing soul of literary character, merely analyzing semantic and intentional possibility of utterances, such as they are readable on surface itself
GT.linkedContent: not probing soul of literary character, merely analyzing semantic and intentional possibility of utterances, such as they are readable on surface itself

GT.content: [no depth beyond literary phenomenon] inviolability of secret depends on essential superficiality, bare device of being-two-to-speak (l’être-deux-à-parler), a secret beyond reserve of technique, thing, being, thing thought (same could be said for money)
GT.linkedContent: [no depth beyond literary phenomenon] inviolability of secret depends on essential superficiality, bare device of being-two-to-speak (l’être-deux-à-parler), a secret beyond reserve of technique, thing, being, thing thought (same could be said for money)

GT.content: secret of literature has no depth, no interiority, spread on the surface of the page, non-psychological structure, not subjective though responsible for most radical effects of subjectivity, a post card, a bank note, a “letter of credit”  [see LOBL p. ~101, & SUBJECTILE]
GT.linkedContent: secret of literature has no depth, no interiority, spread on the surface of the page, non-psychological structure, not subjective though responsible for most radical effects of subjectivity, a post card, a bank note, a “letter of credit” [see LOBL p. ~101, & SUBJECTILE]

OOG.content: “the equivocity of expression is the chosen field for sedimentary deposits,” sedimentations obliterate sense only insofar as there are surfaces available for this [?]
OOG.linkedContent: “the equivocity of expression is the chosen field for sedimentary deposits,” sedimentations obliterate sense only insofar as there are surfaces available for this [?]

MPM.content: when de Man quotes Mallarmé’s “this shallow calumniated stream called death” from “Tomb of Verlaine” (signatory of epitaph always writes on his own tomb), Derrida tells us genealogy of genitives cannot be broken by cenotaph or cremation: the tomb of Verlaine of Mallarmé of Paul de Man
MPM.linkedContent: when de Man quotes Mallarmé’s “this shallow calumniated stream called death” from “Tomb of Verlaine” (signatory of epitaph always writes on his own tomb), Derrida tells us genealogy of genitives cannot be broken by cenotaph or cremation: the tomb of Verlaine of Mallarmé of Paul de Man

MSUBJ.content: subjectile is everything distinct from form, from sense & representation, skin w/holes for pores [Irigaray] > “its presumed depth or thickness can only be seen as a surface,” a flat succubi
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile is everything distinct from form, from sense & representation, skin w/holes for pores [Irigaray] > “its presumed depth or thickness can only be seen as a surface,” a flat succubi

VM.content: [Derrida on Levinas’ method] uses philosophy’s own light to reveal that philosophy’s surface is severely cracked (lézardes), that its solidity is its rigidity > progresses along cracks, negates negations, neither/nor, poetic force of metaphor a trace of this wounding of language
VM.linkedContent: [Derrida on Levinas’ method] uses philosophy’s own light to reveal that philosophy’s surface is severely cracked (lézardes), that its solidity is its rigidity > progresses along cracks, negates negations, neither/nor, poetic force of metaphor a trace of this wounding of language

PP.content: Socratic irony doesn’t bring pharmakon in contact with transparent logos, but reverses its powers, retourne la surface, reveals impropriety of pharmakon, that it can always turn against itself
PP.linkedContent: Socratic irony doesn’t bring pharmakon in contact with transparent logos, but reverses its powers, retourne la surface, reveals impropriety of pharmakon, that it can always turn against itself

PP.content: pharmakon, forever in reserve, no fundamental profundity or locality; it infinitely promises itself and vanishes into a labyrinth
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon, forever in reserve, no fundamental profundity or locality; it infinitely promises itself and vanishes into a labyrinth

PAS.content: Blanchot unleashes what Witz contains or denies, a transparent, neutral, impassive surface of language of writing, beyond/before les lignes de rupture ou de front (psychoanalysis, literature, philosophy, political practice/thought)
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot unleashes what Witz contains or denies, a transparent, neutral, impassive surface of language of writing, beyond/before les lignes de rupture ou de front (psychoanalysis, literature, philosophy, political practice/thought)

PAS.content: sans remarks same X w/out annuling; a springless spring, re-trait, leaves everything in tact, safe, unharmed, on the surface, at the same time it has abducted, erased
PAS.linkedContent: sans remarks same X w/out annuling; a springless spring, re-trait, leaves everything in tact, safe, unharmed, on the surface, at the same time it has abducted, erased

FSW.content: for Freud, consciousness—surface exposed to external world
FSW.linkedContent: for Freud, consciousness—surface exposed to external world

FSW.content: Mystic Pad depth w/out bottom, stratification of surfaces, whose interior is a similarly exposed surface, perfectly superficial exteriority open to incision of scratch
FSW.linkedContent: Mystic Pad depth w/out bottom, stratification of surfaces, whose interior is a similarly exposed surface, perfectly superficial exteriority open to incision of scratch

FSW.content: writing unthinkable w/out repression > Freud uses metaphor of censorship, writing as vigilance [neither permanent contact] & failure [nor permanent break] of censorship
FSW.linkedContent: writing unthinkable w/out repression > Freud uses metaphor of censorship, writing as vigilance [neither permanent contact] & failure [nor permanent break] of censorship

FSW.content: Freud’s Writing Pad (machine) can’t run of itself (like living memory of Plato), a dead complexity w/out depth, multiplicity of layered surfaces
FSW.linkedContent: Freud’s Writing Pad (machine) can’t run of itself (like living memory of Plato), a dead complexity w/out depth, multiplicity of layered surfaces

FSW.content: “life as depth belongs only to the wax of psychical memory,” Plato’s mnemic writing
FSW.linkedContent: “life as depth belongs only to the wax of psychical memory,” Plato’s mnemic writing

F.content: “conservative” repression installs in the unconscious what the Self treats as an exquisite corpse, a “surrealism” of folded sentences loses its creases, the paper flattens out, and there is a spot (lieu) of pleasure disguised as pain, which the therapist must exhume
F.linkedContent: “conservative” repression installs in the unconscious what the Self treats as an exquisite corpse, a “surrealism” of folded sentences loses its creases, the paper flattens out, and there is a spot (lieu) of pleasure disguised as pain, which the therapist must exhume

F.content: [re: Wolf Man’s cryptonomic translations] phonetic contaminations, nonsemantic associations, neither rhetorical figures nor metonymic displacements > but angular: contact (semantic or formal) w/ surface of its allosemes acc. most economical line/surface; angles make itinerary unreadable, makes cryptonomic the once inflexible logic of castration
F.linkedContent: [re: Wolf Man’s cryptonomic translations] phonetic contaminations, nonsemantic associations, neither rhetorical figures nor metonymic displacements > but angular: contact (semantic or formal) w/ surface of its allosemes acc. most economical line/surface; angles make itinerary unreadable, makes cryptonomic the once inflexible logic of castration

DS.content: “the masculine is turned back on the feminine: whole adventure of sexual difference” > in same blow: fold ruptures virginity it marks as virginity, folding over its secret > nothing more virginal (and at same time) more purloined/penetrated than secret (loses smooth simplicity of its surface)
DS.linkedContent: “the masculine is turned back on the feminine: whole adventure of sexual difference” > in same blow: fold ruptures virginity it marks as virginity, folding over its secret > nothing more virginal (and at same time) more purloined/penetrated than secret (loses smooth simplicity of its surface)

DS.content: secret differs before letter opener separates lips of the book, divided from/by itself, like hymen > after the fact, it remains what it was, virgin
DS.linkedContent: secret differs before letter opener separates lips of the book, divided from/by itself, like hymen > after the fact, it remains what it was, virgin

DS.content: opposition btwn metaphor & metonymy is purely semantic—deconstructed by superficial, profound, that is abyssal operation of versification (vers, vers—sens—vers, versus, verre), morcelante et reconstituante (hiver, pervers, envers, travers, vertige, rêve)
DS.linkedContent: opposition btwn metaphor & metonymy is purely semantic—deconstructed by superficial, profound, that is abyssal operation of versification (vers, vers—sens—vers, versus, verre), morcelante et reconstituante (hiver, pervers, envers, travers, vertige, rêve)

DS.content: désertant toute profondeur, chacune de ses faces est aussi, après coup, tout le dé [each surface, once die is cast, is the whole of it]
DS.linkedContent: désertant toute profondeur, chacune de ses faces est aussi, après coup, tout le dé [each surface, once die is cast, is the whole of it]

OS.content: space becomes concrete by retaining/restoring negative w/in itself, by negating itself
OS.linkedContent: space becomes concrete by retaining/restoring negative w/in itself, by negating itself

OS.content: 1st negative determination of space is the POINT (the place that does not take place), it then negates itself in relation the LINE > als sich aufhebend, point is the line, the Being-spatial of point > then comes the PLANE (surface) > each next stage only made of the negated prior stage, i.e. line made of negated points
OS.linkedContent: 1st negative determination of space is the POINT (the place that does not take place), it then negates itself in relation the LINE > als sich aufhebend, point is the line, the Being-spatial of point > then comes the PLANE (surface) > each next stage only made of the negated prior stage, i.e. line made of negated points

ROP.content: “one must” begin by listening to the canon, speaking the language of the patient, necessity of finding surface of manifest meaning > avant de et pour déstabiliser
ROP.linkedContent: “one must” begin by listening to the canon, speaking the language of the patient, necessity of finding surface of manifest meaning > avant de et pour déstabiliser

SP.content: via Nietzsche, woman believes in superficiality of existence, disguising pudendum, nothing more than affair of modesty, decency > “truth” nothing but a surface, becomes desirable by way of veil; suspend the veil, or let it fall differently, no longer truth, only “truth”
SP.linkedContent: via Nietzsche, woman believes in superficiality of existence, disguising pudendum, nothing more than affair of modesty, decency > “truth” nothing but a surface, becomes desirable by way of veil; suspend the veil, or let it fall differently, no longer truth, only “truth”

SP.content: Heidegger’s abyssal structure of the proper, at once superficial & bottomless (since not fundamental), the proper founders, passes into the other
SP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s abyssal structure of the proper, at once superficial & bottomless (since not fundamental), the proper founders, passes into the other

ATIA.content: [from S] the animal-machine that gnaws at the surface of a text, the crossing-out of Being, of traces, a figure of evil, the virus in Derrida’s own writings
ATIA.linkedContent: [from S] the animal-machine that gnaws at the surface of a text, the crossing-out of Being, of traces, a figure of evil, the virus in Derrida’s own writings

FS.content: panoramagram (image of structuralist instrument): obtain on flat surface, depth of objects on horizon > one can glance at field divested of its forces
FS.linkedContent: panoramagram (image of structuralist instrument): obtain on flat surface, depth of objects on horizon > one can glance at field divested of its forces

RGE.content: w/ Hegel, negative is reassuring other surface of the positive
RGE.linkedContent: w/ Hegel, negative is reassuring other surface of the positive

REST.content: point does not bring foot in contact w/ a surface, doesn’t spread out on a surface (the soles, the ground)—surface is lower than the foot, goes lowest (Derrida’s never examined this)
REST.linkedContent: point does not bring foot in contact w/ a surface, doesn’t spread out on a surface (the soles, the ground)—surface is lower than the foot, goes lowest (Derrida’s never examined this)

REST.content: when shoes no longer have strict relation avec un sujet porteur ou porté—they’re the lightened, anonymous, voided support (but so much the heavier abandoned à son inertie opaque) “of an absent subject whose name haunts the open form”
REST.linkedContent: when shoes no longer have strict relation avec un sujet porteur ou porté—they’re the lightened, anonymous, voided support (but so much the heavier abandoned à son inertie opaque) “of an absent subject whose name haunts the open form”

REST.content: never completely open, the shoe maintains a form, that of the foot > describes external surface or envelope of what is called a “form” [Derrida quotes from Littré, where “form” is wood in shape (figure) of foot, then he links figure to face—Shapiro sees Van Gogh’s in “his” shoes]
REST.linkedContent: never completely open, the shoe maintains a form, that of the foot > describes external surface or envelope of what is called a “form” [Derrida quotes from Littré, where “form” is wood in shape (figure) of foot, then he links figure to face—Shapiro sees Van Gogh’s in “his” shoes]

REST.content: the pas de contact (pas de sujet) of Van Gogh’s shoes, a detachment whose reattachment is sought in its fundamental surface, the sole, or the fundamental subjectivity of the ground
REST.linkedContent: the pas de contact (pas de sujet) of Van Gogh’s shoes, a detachment whose reattachment is sought in its fundamental surface, the sole, or the fundamental subjectivity of the ground

REST.content: pas de contact, rhythmically, makes marche, pas is not present nor absent ——pas works (marche) badly w/out a pair
REST.linkedContent: pas de contact, rhythmically, makes marche, pas is not present nor absent ——pas works (marche) badly w/out a pair

D.content: Soller’s Numbers is exemplary re: the reader, cette fois enfin, the text shows (montrée) that a reader cannot choose his/her place in a text > does so by composing surfaces retournées & par une mise en scène matérielle exacte
D.linkedContent: Soller’s Numbers is exemplary re: the reader, cette fois enfin, the text shows (montrée) that a reader cannot choose his/her place in a text > does so by composing surfaces retournées & par une mise en scène matérielle exacte

D.content: in Soller’s Numbers, only 1/ 4 surfaces donnant lieu to moment of visibility, de la présence en vis-à-vis (face-to-face), counting out the phenomenon > surface is mounted (montée)
D.linkedContent: in Soller’s Numbers, only 1/ 4 surfaces donnant lieu to moment of visibility, de la présence en vis-à-vis (face-to-face), counting out the phenomenon > surface is mounted (montée)

D.content: passage toward other, se resserrer (fitting itself) into the angles btwn the surfaces, dans l’entre-surface [inter(sur)face] > articulation of one surface sur l’autre (d’un temps sur l’autre)
D.linkedContent: passage toward other, se resserrer (fitting itself) into the angles btwn the surfaces, dans l’entre-surface [inter(sur)face] > articulation of one surface sur l’autre (d’un temps sur l’autre)

D.content: Derrida’s text: re-marks passage [in Soller’s], repeats square by closing angle, opens another surface of writing to-come: play w/ cardo, hinge, cardinal points; remarque d’angle: all lines broken
D.linkedContent: Derrida’s text: re-marks passage [in Soller’s], repeats square by closing angle, opens another surface of writing to-come: play w/ cardo, hinge, cardinal points; remarque d’angle: all lines broken

D.content: by a folding-back (reploiement) or internal angle of surface: face (frons scaenae) contemplates itself as unconditioned opening of appearance, but explains itself as surface-effect, as conditioned [by square apparatus]
D.linkedContent: by a folding-back (reploiement) or internal angle of surface: face (frons scaenae) contemplates itself as unconditioned opening of appearance, but explains itself as surface-effect, as conditioned [by square apparatus]

D.content: opening of presence, “dead surface,” 4th surface, plunged by its “history” into limitless time that is neither “present” nor a “history”
D.linkedContent: opening of presence, “dead surface,” 4th surface, plunged by its “history” into limitless time that is neither “present” nor a “history”

D.content: Soller’s open square: open side, air, mirror, veil
D.linkedContent: Soller’s open square: open side, air, mirror, veil

D.content: Soller: single sheet gives sensation of depth, representation, reflection
D.linkedContent: Soller: single sheet gives sensation of depth, representation, reflection

D.content: mercury, tain of this ink: a screen: visible projection surface for images, & prevents one from seeing other side
D.linkedContent: mercury, tain of this ink: a screen: visible projection surface for images, & prevents one from seeing other side

D.content: each part of mirror larger than whole (mirror smaller than itself): 4th surface paradigm of this relation
D.linkedContent: each part of mirror larger than whole (mirror smaller than itself): 4th surface paradigm of this relation

D.content: the inside of text will always have been outside it; reciprocal contamination of body proper, violent expatriation, poison affirmed—mercury in its tain is a poison
D.linkedContent: the inside of text will always have been outside it; reciprocal contamination of body proper, violent expatriation, poison affirmed—mercury in its tain is a poison

D.content: “I” as surface vacant of itself: foments (prepares a poison) cruel dispossession > reaches simulacrum point: où il peut à la fois teindre le tissu (stains the tissue) et feindre to tell you truth about it
D.linkedContent: “I” as surface vacant of itself: foments (prepares a poison) cruel dispossession > reaches simulacrum point: où il peut à la fois teindre le tissu (stains the tissue) et feindre to tell you truth about it

D.content: a summons, provocation, face-to-face [w/ what?]
D.linkedContent: a summons, provocation, face-to-face [w/ what?]

D.content: authority & property still remain, but as pretensions of attending discourse, dead surface effects
D.linkedContent: authority & property still remain, but as pretensions of attending discourse, dead surface effects

D.content: one’s undifferentiated proximity to oneself: another name for death > the space of property: “dead surface”
D.linkedContent: one’s undifferentiated proximity to oneself: another name for death > the space of property: “dead surface”

D.content: opening paradoxically wrought as a thing that closes (squares of cubes)
D.linkedContent: opening paradoxically wrought as a thing that closes (squares of cubes)

D.content: already plunged by imperfect into already opened thickness of another text
D.linkedContent: already plunged by imperfect into already opened thickness of another text

D.content: moment of present meaning: their “content” only surface effect into which you tombez sans cesse, fascinés by appearance
D.linkedContent: moment of present meaning: their “content” only surface effect into which you tombez sans cesse, fascinés by appearance

D.content: transformations of meaning hinge on certain squaring of text, obligatory passage through open surface, detour through empty square, around the column of fire
D.linkedContent: transformations of meaning hinge on certain squaring of text, obligatory passage through open surface, detour through empty square, around the column of fire

D.content: semantic order entangled in seminal, that which was never itself, never comes back to itself; semantic, as a moment of desire, signifies reappropriation of seed w/in presence > the seminal’s dream of death: seed wanting to keep itself
D.linkedContent: semantic order entangled in seminal, that which was never itself, never comes back to itself; semantic, as a moment of desire, signifies reappropriation of seed w/in presence > the seminal’s dream of death: seed wanting to keep itself

D.content: column is not, passage of dissemination, “phallic” significance of column is a semic effect, reflection on 4th surface (described center, represented mastery of dissemination); “is”—procures calm, consciousness of ideal mastery > operation of 4th surface
D.linkedContent: column is not, passage of dissemination, “phallic” significance of column is a semic effect, reflection on 4th surface (described center, represented mastery of dissemination); “is”—procures calm, consciousness of ideal mastery > operation of 4th surface

D.content: column has no being, belongs to no one
D.linkedContent: column has no being, belongs to no one

D.content: thickness (l’épaisseur) of text opens upon beyond of a whole, nothing or absolute outside: its depth (sa profondeur) at once null & infinite—each layer (couche) harbors (en abrite) another
D.linkedContent: thickness (l’épaisseur) of text opens upon beyond of a whole, nothing or absolute outside: its depth (sa profondeur) at once null & infinite—each layer (couche) harbors (en abrite) another

D.content: au bord (du vertige), alert to the border itself, infinite depths were also bottomless, perfectly superficial, cube w/out depth
D.linkedContent: au bord (du vertige), alert to the border itself, infinite depths were also bottomless, perfectly superficial, cube w/out depth

D.content: each angle of square belongs to totality of surface, but multiplies it by folding back on itself, fractures it [the surface]—leaving room for supplementary attending (d’assistance) surface
D.linkedContent: each angle of square belongs to totality of surface, but multiplies it by folding back on itself, fractures it [the surface]—leaving room for supplementary attending (d’assistance) surface

D.content: same w/ supernumerary (surnombre) (column of words): is part of the numeral and belongs (appartient) to very milieu it exceeds
D.linkedContent: same w/ supernumerary (surnombre) (column of words): is part of the numeral and belongs (appartient) to very milieu it exceeds

EL.content: for Scholem, secularized = pulling out language’s apocalyptic thorn; but secularization does not take place, a surface effect, language still sacred in its abyssal interior
EL.linkedContent: for Scholem, secularized = pulling out language’s apocalyptic thorn; but secularization does not take place, a surface effect, language still sacred in its abyssal interior

EL.content: secular is a epiphenomenon, surface (rhetorical) effect, a façon de parler
EL.linkedContent: secular is a epiphenomenon, surface (rhetorical) effect, a façon de parler

EL.content: secular is surface effect, produces the surface on which we sleepwalk, we believe in the surface, but there is only abyss > speak sacred language even in denying it (avoid speaking it)
EL.linkedContent: secular is surface effect, produces the surface on which we sleepwalk, we believe in the surface, but there is only abyss > speak sacred language even in denying it (avoid speaking it)

+R.content: plus d’air, plus r [+R]; each letter, especially gl: re-marks the slippery surface, angled word, edge of tomb, hooked (crochue) signature
+R.linkedContent: plus d’air, plus r [+R]; each letter, especially gl: re-marks the slippery surface, angled word, edge of tomb, hooked (crochue) signature

C.content: work of the angle (RECTIFIES in all senses) resounds on more than one surface: kills, repairs, restores, recaptures, then once more (inexhaustible debt until the échéance of a dice throw)
C.linkedContent: work of the angle (RECTIFIES in all senses) resounds on more than one surface: kills, repairs, restores, recaptures, then once more (inexhaustible debt until the échéance of a dice throw)

TN.content: can only touch on a surface, peau, pellicule
limit, deprived of body, does not touch itself, does not let itself be touched
TN.linkedContent: limit, deprived of body, does not touch itself, does not let itself be touched

TN.content: Nancy’s partes extra partes, everything outside another outside; p. 14 fold of becoming-inside of the first outside, nothing but surfaces & outsides w/out insides: superficies of surfaces are limits, exposed to a touch that can only leave them intact, untouchable > irreducible disseminal divisibility
TN.linkedContent: Nancy’s partes extra partes, everything outside another outside; p. 14 fold of becoming-inside of the first outside, nothing but surfaces & outsides w/out insides: superficies of surfaces are limits, exposed to a touch that can only leave them intact, untouchable > irreducible disseminal divisibility

TN.content: for Nancy, touching the limit > moment of decision
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, touching the limit > moment of decision

TN.content: philosophy, literally, has never touched anything > inversely, all one ever does is touch a limit (destiny of this figurality) [hymen]; to touch is to touch a limit, a surface, a border, an outline
TN.linkedContent: philosophy, literally, has never touched anything > inversely, all one ever does is touch a limit (destiny of this figurality) [hymen]; to touch is to touch a limit, a surface, a border, an outline

TN.content: touch untouchable-touchable surface/border/limit on exposing edge of an abyss
TN.linkedContent: touch untouchable-touchable surface/border/limit on exposing edge of an abyss

TN.content: philosophy will have “touched” something 2x: limit & unfoundable abyss beneath/beyond it
TN.linkedContent: philosophy will have “touched” something 2x: limit & unfoundable abyss beneath/beyond it

TN.content: there can only be a figure of touch, one only touches by way of figure > the object, the touchable thing, the "thing itself,” is the untouchable (gives itself, opens only in history of figure)
TN.linkedContent: there can only be a figure of touch, one only touches by way of figure > the object, the touchable thing, the "thing itself,” is the untouchable (gives itself, opens only in history of figure)

TN.content: always writing a story, tangent touches line/surface w/out intersection, a tangent touches one point, point is nothing, a limit w/out depth or surface, untouchable even as a figure
TN.linkedContent: always writing a story, tangent touches line/surface w/out intersection, a tangent touches one point, point is nothing, a limit w/out depth or surface, untouchable even as a figure

TN.content: Husserl struggles to describe the self-touch of the heart, w/out appealing to double apprehension of hand > heart sensation beneath the surface when you push on your chest [?]
TN.linkedContent: Husserl struggles to describe the self-touch of the heart, w/out appealing to double apprehension of hand > heart sensation beneath the surface when you push on your chest [?]

TN.content: how the hand led us to the other surface, the other of sense, while trying to demonstrate auto-affection
TN.linkedContent: how the hand led us to the other surface, the other of sense, while trying to demonstrate auto-affection

TN.content: Nancy: “created body” is a tautology [what else but body is created?], body is the coming into presence as being this screen [no depth]
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: “created body” is a tautology [what else but body is created?], body is the coming into presence as being this screen [no depth]

TN.content: differance btwn 2 surfaces: condition of contact & originarily spaced opening that calls for technical prosthetics (makes it possible w/out delay)
TN.linkedContent: differance btwn 2 surfaces: condition of contact & originarily spaced opening that calls for technical prosthetics (makes it possible w/out delay)

E.content: once inserted into another network, the “same” philosopheme is no longer the same > inversely, “unique and original (inédits)” philosophemes, if there are any, once they enter network of inherited philosophemes, they’re affected over their whole surface and under every angle > the very project of rigorous criteria for judging philosophical specificity, which we are nowhere near disposing of, belongs to a set of conditions (un ensemble)—that remains to be thought
E.linkedContent: once inserted into another network, the “same” philosopheme is no longer the same > inversely, “unique and original (inédits)” philosophemes, if there are any, once they enter network of inherited philosophemes, they’re affected over their whole surface and under every angle > the very project of rigorous criteria for judging philosophical specificity, which we are nowhere near disposing of, belongs to a set of conditions (un ensemble)—that remains to be thought

OG.content: the horizontality of spacing, hollow of differance, discontinuity and discreteness (does not oppose it(self) like surface to depth), a hinge (brisure) marking impossibility of full speech
OG.linkedContent: the horizontality of spacing, hollow of differance, discontinuity and discreteness (does not oppose it(self) like surface to depth), a hinge (brisure) marking impossibility of full speech

OG.content: exposed surface of body signifies, marks forever, the division working auto-affection
OG.linkedContent: exposed surface of body signifies, marks forever, the division working auto-affection

SPEC.content: Freud repeats his arrest, pas de marche: speculative possibility of tout autre (than PP), inscribed in advance w/in it, “l’ouvre d’une scription de l’autre à meme (overlaps) le principe”
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud repeats his arrest, pas de marche: speculative possibility of tout autre (than PP), inscribed in advance w/in it, “l’ouvre d’une scription de l’autre à meme (overlaps) le principe”

SPEC.content: la surface même du “à même (overlap)” does not belong to itself—writing affects the very surface of its support > non-belonging unleashes speculation
SPEC.linkedContent: la surface même du “à même (overlap)” does not belong to itself—writing affects the very surface of its support > non-belonging unleashes speculation
